dismissalText.long: c Shafiul Islam b Shahadat Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Hafeez c Shafiul Islam b Shahadat Hossain 89 (126b 7x4 0x6 153m) SR: 70.63

dismissalComment.html: Shahadat picks up his second wicket this spell, Pakistan have lost two quickly, a short ball on middle, came on to Hafeez quicker than he would have liked, got a top edge and Shafiul took a dolly at square leg

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Jamshed run out (Shakib Al Hasan/†Mushfiqur Rahim) 54 (64b 5x4 1x6 120m) SR: 84.37

dismissalComment.html: run-out, a strong throw from Shakib at point as Hafeez played it towards him, Jamshed called for the single, the throw was a little wide but Mushfiqur gathered and took down the bails just in time, Jamshed is short of the crease

headshotImage.caption: Shahadat Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahadat Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone, Younis has to go, Shahadat sends him back, Younis moved way too across to that good length ball on middle and tried to flick it square but closed the face too early, Razzak standing at point judged it well

Shahadat picks up his second wicket this spell, Pakistan have lost two quickly, a short ball on middle, came on to Hafeez quicker than he would have liked, got a top edge and Shafiul took a dolly at square leg

headshotImage.caption: Asad Shafiq player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asad Shafiq player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: The short ball works again for Shahadat, Pakistan losing their way here, banged in short and Asad goes hard at it, went for the hook but couldn't connect well, holed out to deep square leg where Mashrafe ran across a little and judged it well

Shakib has bowled superbly this Powerplay, Umar, keen to take advantage of the field pulled in, went for the slog-sweep, got a top-edge and Razzak, running back from square leg, juggled once but kept his calm to snap it on the second attempt

Is he gone? Shakib is claiming the catch, Afridi just struck it back loosely towards the bowler. Did it carry cleanly, did he drop it before taking it on the second attempt? That's what the umpires are checking. Wow. He missed it on the first attempt and got a hand to it just as it was dying down on the second; he palmed it towards Misbah, the ball ricocheted off Misbah and landed safely in Shakib's hand on the third attempt. Big wicket, the slide continues and Bangladesh, you would say, have edged ahead here.

dismissalComment.html: bowled'im! Pakistan have won, Gul came over the wicket, bowled it on a good length and he swung mightily at that one, had no choice, got an inside edge onto the pads and then onto the stumps. The umpires want a replay to check if that was a no-ball, it wasn't.

headshotImage.longCaption: Shahadat Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Umar Gul 64 (66b 4x4 0x6 130m) SR: 96.96

commentPreTextItems.html: Shakib needs to go for it now, the difference betweens balls and runs has gone up significantly. Gul to finish off his spell now. Fine leg is up, massive gap between third man and deep point

commentTextItems.html: bowled'im! Pakistan have won, Gul came over the wicket, bowled it on a good length and he swung mightily at that one, had no choice, got an inside edge onto the pads and then onto the stumps. The umpires want a replay to check if that was a no-ball, it wasn't.

commentPostTextItems.html: Gul stars in an all-round effort, it was his contribution at the end of Pakistan's innings and his stand with Sarfraz Ahmed that made the difference in the end. He backed that up with 3 for 58 and it should be no surprise if he walks away with the Man-of-the-Match award. Bangladesh fought well, first picking some quick wickets after a century opening stand to put Pakistan under pressure. Then, they came out positively in the chase, Tamim, Nasir and Shakib trying hard to keep their team within reach but the pressure got to the batsmen when the required-rate crept up beyond six. Pakistan kept their cool and snatched a win in the end.
We've had an exciting start to the Asia Cup, the hosts showing they'll be no pushovers. Do stay tuned in for the presentation. Abhishek Purohit is updating his report for this match.

Mushfiqur: "We were really close, I thought we came back well in our bowling. Our batsmen did a good job at the start, the most important was Nasir's wicket at the end. We just couldn't finish well. We are not winning most of the times after getting into such situations."

Misbah: "it was tough, we should have got 300. Again, we just messed it up. The guys are not learning from their mistakes. The pitch was absolutely perfect for batting, no spin, nothing for the fast bowlers but again the bowlers did good for us. We just have to lift our performances, we need to be more positive and we can't just repeat these mistakes. The bowlers are winning games for us for the last year and a half, but we need to support them."
Mohammad Hafeez has been given the Man of the Match award, I thought it'll be Gul. But anyway, that's what the jury has decided. He made 89 and picked up two wickets.

Hafeez: "I was not having a great time in the last series, very happy with this. I worked with my batting coach, I was just thinking of spending more time at the crease. Jamshed really took the pressure off me earlier on, we gave a good start."
That's it from us, folks. Thanks for tuning in, sending us your feedback. Do join us for the next game, that's India v Sri Lanka on March 13th. See you then, cheers.

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Shahadat Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Asad Shafiq c Mashrafe Mortaza b Shahadat Hossain 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: The short ball works again for Shahadat, Pakistan losing their way here, banged in short and Asad goes hard at it, went for the hook but couldn't connect well, holed out to deep square leg where Mashrafe ran across a little and judged it well

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Misbah-ul-Haq b Abdur Razzak 8 (13b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 61.53

dismissalComment.html: Cleaned him up, that went on straight, what a collapse! Misbah was fooled by the straighter one and he played outside the line waiting for the turn, was stuck on the crease, landed on middle and off and bowled him through the gate, seven down now

dismissalText.commentary: Shahid Afridi c & b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Is he gone? Shakib is claiming the catch, Afridi just struck it back loosely towards the bowler. Did it carry cleanly, did he drop it before taking it on the second attempt? That's what the umpires are checking. Wow. He missed it on the first attempt and got a hand to it just as it was dying down on the second; he palmed it towards Misbah, the ball ricocheted off Misbah and landed safely in Shakib's hand on the third attempt. Big wicket, the slide continues and Bangladesh, you would say, have edged ahead here.

dismissalText.commentary: Sarfaraz Ahmed not out 19 (28b 0x4 0x6 43m) SR: 67.85

dismissalComment.html: Tamim goes, another batsman goes trying to cut the ball, Hafeez angles that in from round the wicket, Tamim waited for it and was trying to run it past short third man, gets an inside edge onto the stumps, Pakistan have struck a crucial blow

dismissalText.commentary: Nazimuddin c Umar Gul b Aizaz Cheema 30 (33b 4x4 1x6 41m) SR: 90.9

dismissalComment.html: Nazimuddin goes, short and wide and it's slashed hard, flies off the outside edge and Umar Gul at third man back-pedals and takes it over his head, judged really well a few yards inside the ropes

dismissalText.commentary: Jahurul Islam b Shahid Afridi 23 (31b 3x4 0x6 40m) SR: 74.19

dismissalComment.html: Jahrul admonishes himself for that lapse, flighted and he was tempted, bent low and tried to slog-sweep that into the stands, it went on straight, he missed and that crashed into the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim b Shahid Afridi 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: too close to cut, he'd tried doing that off his first ball against Afridi as well, fired in quick from Afridi and that kept low, he was trying to cut that, misjudgement on his part there, he missed and off stump was pegged back

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Umar Gul 64 (66b 4x4 0x6 130m) SR: 96.96

dismissalComment.html: bowled'im! Pakistan have won, Gul came over the wicket, bowled it on a good length and he swung mightily at that one, had no choice, got an inside edge onto the pads and then onto the stumps. The umpires want a replay to check if that was a no-ball, it wasn't.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah lbw b Mohammad Hafeez 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh are sliding now, Mahmudullah goes! Tossed up and he shapes up to play the sweep first ball, missed, it struck him on middle and leg, it did turn down and would have slightly missed leg stump as the replays show. The umpire, however, felt otherwise

headshotImage.caption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain b Umar Gul 47 (49b 3x4 1x6 70m) SR: 95.91

dismissalComment.html: bowled'im! Gul has fought back by castling Nasir, was fired in towards middle and leg, Nasir moved across and tried to close the face on that one, was probably done in for pace there, ricocheted off the pads onto the stumps

series.name: Asia Cup
series.description: Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka in Bangladesh

seriesStandings.notes:
Preliminary Matches Win, with bonus point - 5
Win, without bonus point - 4
Tie or No Result - 2
Loss - 0 In the event of teams finishing on equal points, the right to play in the final match or series will be determined as follows:
  • The team with the most number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the most number of wins over the other team(s) who are equal on points and have the same number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the highest number of bonus points
  • If still equal, the team with the highest net run rate
In a match declared as no result, run rate is not applicable. Net Run Rate A team's net run rate is calculated by deducting from the average runs per over scored by that team throughout the competition, the average runs per over scored against that team throughout the competition. In the event of a team being all out in less than its full quota of overs, the calculation of its net run rate shall be based on the full quota of overs to which it would have been entitled and not on the number of overs in which the team was dismissed. Only those matches where results are achieved will count for the purpose of net run rate calculations. Where a match is abandoned, but a result is achieved under Duckworth/Lewis, for net run rate purposes Team 1 will be accredited with Team 2's Par Score on abandonment off the same number of overs faced by Team 2. Where a match is concluded but with Duckworth/Lewis having been applied at an earlier point in the match, Team 1 will be accredited with 1 run less than the final Target Score for Team 2 off the total number of overs allocated to Team 2 to reach the target. Bonus Points The team that achieves a run rate of 1.25 times that of the opposition shall be awarded one bonus point. A team's run rate will be calculated by reference to the runs scored in an innings divided by the number of overs faced.
